metadata.Title: CVE-2011-2716 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The DHCP client (udhcpc) in BusyBox before 1.20.0 allows remote DHCP servers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the (1) HOST_NAME, (2) DOMAIN_NAME, (3) NIS_DOMAIN, and (4) TFTP_SERVER_NAME host name options.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-2716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
busybox-static - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
udhcpc - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
udhcpd - 1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> similar to CVE-2011-0997, but for busybox

criterions.comment: busybox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.22.0-9ubuntu1').
